intro: Rhacoma latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf rhacoma, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Rhacoma latifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an attractive species for horticultural cultivation in suitable climates.
